abstract: Google is scanning microfilm from newspaper archives to make them searchable online, first through Google News and eventually on the papers’ own Web sites.
snippet: Google is scanning microfilm from newspaper archives to make them searchable online, first through Google News and eventually on the papers’ own Web sites.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Google has begun scanning microfilm from some newspapers’ historic archives to make them searchable online, first through Google News and eventually on the papers’ own Web sites, the company said Monday.

abstract: Under the agreement, NBC will make a relatively small amount of advertising time on networks available for sale through Google’s TV Ads program in the coming months.
snippet: Under the agreement, NBC will make a relatively small amount of advertising time on networks available for sale through Google’s TV Ads program in the coming months.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Google will begin selling ads on some cable networks owned by NBC Universal in a new partnership that will expand Google’s efforts to become a force in television advertising, the companies said late Monday.

headline.main: Google Strikes Partnership With NBC to Expand in TV Advertising
headline.print_headline: Google Strikes Partnership With NBC to Expand in TV Advertising

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Brian Stelter

abstract: Google will begin selling ads on some cable networks owned by NBC Universal in a new partnership.
snippet: Google will begin selling ads on some cable networks owned by NBC Universal in a new partnership.
lead_paragraph: Google will begin selling ads on some cable networks owned by NBC Universal in a new partnership that will expand Google’s efforts to become a force in television advertising, the companies said late Monday.

headline.main: Google to Sell Some NBC Cable Ads

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Brian Stelter

abstract: Under pressure from regulators and activists, Google tightened its data retention policies, saying it would anonymize search records after nine months, instead of the previous policy of holding identifiable records for 18 months.
snippet: Under pressure from regulators and activists, Google tightened its data retention policies, saying it would anonymize search records after nine months, instead of the previous policy of holding identifiable records for 18 months.
lead_paragraph: Under pressure from regulators, policymakers and privacy advocates around the world, Google said late Monday that it would further tighten its data retention policy. In its official blog, the company said it would “anonymize” search records after 9 months, rather than the current 18 months.

headline.main: Google Tightens Data Retention Policy — Again

abstract: In the wake of Diane Greene’s departure, three other key executives have left, and competitors are readying fresh assaults on VMware’s dominant position in the virtualization software market.
snippet: In the wake of Diane Greene’s departure, three other key executives have left, and competitors are readying fresh assaults on VMware’s dominant position in the virtualization software market.
lead_paragraph: In the summer of 2007, Diane Greene was lauded as a business hero for leading VMware, a maker of business software, to the hottest stock debut since Google. But in the ensuing year, despite her popularity with employees and on Wall Street, her relationship with her directors, and especially VMware’s chairman, Joseph M. Tucci, grew increasingly chilly.

headline.main: At VMware, a Firing Is Still Reverberating
headline.print_headline: At VMware, a Firing Is Still Reverberating

abstract: One of the leaders in the new field of consumer genetic information, is expected to announce on Tuesday that it is cutting the price of its service deeply, to $399, down from $999.
snippet: One of the leaders in the new field of consumer genetic information, is expected to announce on Tuesday that it is cutting the price of its service deeply, to $399, down from $999.
lead_paragraph: The price of a personal genetic profile is about to get a lot lower.

headline.main: DNA Profile Provider Is Cutting Its Prices
headline.print_headline: DNA Profile Provider Is Cutting Its Prices

abstract: A start-up with the goal of bring high-speed Internet access to poor countries around the world via satellite is prepping for takeoff, after snagging funding from heavy hitters, including Google, The Wall Street Journal reported.
lead_paragraph: A start-up with the goal of bring high-speed Internet access to poor countries around the world via satellite is prepping for takeoff, after snagging funding from heavy hitters, including Google, The Wall Street Journal reported.

abstract: In the summer of 2007, Diane Greene was lauded as a business hero for leading VMware, a maker of business software, to the hottest stock debut since Google. But, The New York Times’ Ashlee Vance says, in the ensuing year, despite her popularity with employees and on Wall Street, her relationship with her directors, and especially VMware’s chairman, Joseph M. Tucci, grew increasingly chilly.
